lom:description.lom:string:
The Nanomanufacturing Summer Academy is a 6-week summer research program sponsored by the National Science Foundation to provide undergraduate research experience in the area of nanomanufacturing.
What is the purpose of this program? The purpose of this program is to prepare, motivate, and encourage students to pursue an advanced degree in the area of engineering. To help maximize each participantÂ’s experience, each student will be paired with a faculty mentor and graduate mentor.
